reviewText: One of my favorite actor is Hyun Bin.  He always creates the atmosphere for his role in any kind of situation.  He's just terrific and lovable.  Hope to see him in more movies and TV dramas.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First off, Hyun Bin....lordy, he is pretty.  The story revolves around a spoiled grandchild who's inheritance from his grandfather mandates that he go to school AND GRADUATE from a country school the grandfather had chosen.  This is a coming of age, becoming an adult and taking responsibility for your choices movie.  Warning, it has sad parts that will make you reach for the Kleenex box, but it is a beautiful movie and well worth adding to your Romance Movie library.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's a real pity that this movie is so easily available on viral video sites because it is a movie that should be owned and watched over and over again (especially on chilly rainy nights). The story is very well-written (yes, there are your typical K-drama/K-movie coincidences), well executed, and beautifully paced. Hyun Bin Fans: This man ROCKS. His acting is just so remarkably polished, I am awed every time I watch the movie. Great stuff from a (young) terrific actor.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The title is kind of misleading, because it doesn't reveal anything about the real story.  I think that's a good thing, but a lot of people may miss out on this movie if they go by titles alone.I wasn't sure when it started watching if I was going to like it, but a few more minutes in and I was hooked!  It's a happy, but sad movie.  It made me smile and it made me cry, then it made me smile again.  The male and female lead actors were excellent in their roles.  Good job casting director!I think this is going to be one of those movies that I will watch over and over again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: you won't believe how sappy the story is - well - you might if youre familiar with the typical korean drama with a spoiled rich kid and terminally ill poor kid - this story adhered so tenciously to the formula that i could anticipate just about everything - not even the appealing lee yeon hee has what it takes to save a film that goes for the tear-ducts -- with a sledgehammer
Title: N/A

reviewText: Now this is a good movie.  But, after watching so many classic Korean dramas which are usually 16 to 30 episodes (about an hour per episode), this movie will fall short of expectations.  Classic Korean dramas such as "Boys Over Flowers", "The Secret Garden" (which also stars Hyun Bin), and many others are more well-developed and well-made because they are longer- much longer.Otherwise, this is a well-made movie.
summary: Good Movie with Familiar Theme and of course a Familiar Ending

reviewText: This is a cute story with a sad ending.  Well done and enjoyable.  As always Hyun Bin delivers, even if this is one of his earlier works.
